semantic_title: Z Codes That May Only be Principal/First-Listed Diagnosis - Comprehensive List and Usage Rules
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 21. Chapter 21: Factors influencing health status and contact with health services (Z00-Z99) > c. Categories of Z Codes > 15) Z Codes That May Only be Principal/First-Listed Diagnosis

content.full_text: The following Z codes/subcategories/categories may only be reported as the principal/first-listed diagnosis, except when there are multiple encounters on the same day and the medical records for the encounters are combined (Evidence: pg no: 105-106, L24-L25)
content.summary: Comprehensive list of Z codes that are restricted to principal or first-listed diagnosis position with exception for combined same-day encounters (Evidence: pg no: 105-106, L24-L25)
key_concepts: Specific Z codes restricted to principal/first-listed position (Evidence: pg no: 105, L24)
Exception exists for multiple same-day encounters with combined records (Evidence: pg no: 105-106, L25)
Comprehensive list includes examination, procedure, and care encounter codes (Evidence: pg no: 106, L26-L51)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Listed Z codes may only be reported as principal/first-listed diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 105, L24)
detailed_rules.explanation: These codes represent the primary reason for the healthcare encounter and cannot be used as secondary diagnoses (Evidence: pg no: 105, L24)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Exception applies when multiple encounters occur on same day with combined medical records (Evidence: pg no: 105-106, L25)
detailed_rules.explanation: When encounters are combined into single record, the restriction may not apply (Evidence: pg no: 105-106, L25)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify if Z code is on the restricted list
Step 2: Verify if encounter qualifies for principal/first-listed position
Step 3: Check for same-day multiple encounter exception

code_ranges.description: Encounter for general examination without complaint, suspected or reported diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 106, L26)
Encounter for other special examination without complaint, suspected or reported diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 106, L28-L29)
Encounter for administrative examination (Evidence: pg no: 106, L30)
Encounter for examination and observation for other reasons (Evidence: pg no: 106, L31)
Encounter for supervision of normal pregnancy (Evidence: pg no: 106, L37)
Liveborn infants according to place of birth and type of delivery (Evidence: pg no: 106, L39-L40)
Encounter for maternal postpartum care and examination (Evidence: pg no: 106, L38)
Encounter for prophylactic surgery (Evidence: pg no: 106, L41)
Encounter for plastic and reconstructive surgery following medical procedure or healed injury (Evidence: pg no: 106, L42-L43)
Donors of organs and tissues (Evidence: pg no: 106, L46)
usage_rules: Except Z52.9, Donor of unspecified organ or tissue (Evidence: pg no: 106, L47)

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient presents for routine annual physical examination
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Annual physical examination - patient healthy, no complaints
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify encounter type as routine examination
Step 4: Add any additional findings as secondary diagnoses

correct_coding.rationale: Z00 codes may only be used as principal/first-listed diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 106, L26-L27)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Cannot be used as secondary diagnosis
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Attempting to use routine examination codes as secondary diagnoses

warnings: These Z codes cannot be used as secondary diagnoses (Evidence: pg no: 105, L24)
Exception only applies to same-day combined encounters (Evidence: pg no: 105-106, L25)
best_practices: Verify encounter type matches code restriction requirements
Check for same-day encounter combinations before applying restrictions
common_mistakes: Using restricted Z codes as secondary diagnoses
tips: Review complete list before coding encounters
Consider encounter documentation carefully for appropriate sequencing
implementation_notes: May affect coding workflow for multiple encounters
